feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 29 at 5:56AM AKDT until June 29 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY... * Winds...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Timing...Hot, dry, and windy conditions are expected Thursday afternoon and evening.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued June 29 at 5:46AM AKDT until July 01 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKDT FRIDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE WESTERN ALASKA RANGE... * Winds...Southeast 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...75 to 80 degrees. 60s over higher elevations.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Flooding from Lake Drainage near Nuiqsut... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MID-WEEK... With record heat, significant snowmelt in higher terrain has caused high river levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, although high water is anticipated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:35PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Escambia, northern Santa Rosa and north central Escambia Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1235 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Jay to near Roeville. Movement was northwest at 25 mph.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 28 at 9:08PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surf heights of 11 to 14 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores. * TIMING...through Wednesday. * IMPACTS...high surfs and strong rip currents. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 29 at 12:11PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Thursday, June 30, 2022. entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 12:05PM MDT until June 29 at 12:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL GARFIELD AND EAST CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES... At 1204 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Panguitch, or 28 miles south of Junction, moving northeast at 10 mph. Around noon, a funnel cloud has been spotted within this storm. HAZARD...Quarter size hail.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:05PM MDT until June 29 at 12:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL GARFIELD AND EAST CENTRAL IRON COUNTIES... At 1204 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Panguitch, or 28 miles south of Junction, moving northeast at 10 mph. Around noon, a funnel cloud has been spotted within this storm. HAZARD...Quarter size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 11:54AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington County through 1230 PM MDT... At 1154 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Apple Valley, or near Colorado City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued June 29 at 10:32AM AST until July 01 at 6:00AM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Beaches of southeastern, northwestern, and north central Puerto Rico and beaches of Culebra, Vieques and St Croix.
